TopicTitle: How to make gimballing engines and surface controls?

Articles.Content:
Hello all.

I can make a model of part, I can texture part, I can configure the part. I have already made ??parts for KSP. But I don\'t know how to make gimballing engine or winglet. Can sombody explain me, how to make them? I\'m using 3d\'s max 2012.

You want to make sure that the mesh intended to move is named 'obj_gimbal' for gimbaled engines. What the corresponding meshname is for winglets I don\'t remember, but you can find that out by opening the vanilla winglet .dae file with a text editing program.

In both cases the mesh will rotate around the scene origin, hope that helps.
Really? Just create 'obj_gimbal', and it will work? Without animations, scripts and etc.?
Yeah, that\'s it. Ksp 'Animates' the mesh by simply letting it rotate around the scene origin.

Really? Just create 'obj_gimbal', and it will work? Without animations, scripts and etc.?

You may even skip that object name and just set thrustVectoringCapable = True in part.cfg. KSP will rotate an entire mesh around (0, 0, 0) point

I dunno would it work for ControlSurfaces though.
